explains: v. 放大，扩大；夸张，夸大；使（问题）加重，加剧；<古>赞美，颂扬

sentences.en: If you really magnify the spectrum of the sunlight, you could identify more than 100,000 of them.
sentences.cn: 如果你真的放大太阳光的光谱，你可以分辨出多达10万条的光谱线。

sentences.en: One of the easiest ways to segment a market is to magnify gender differences or invent them where they did not previously exist.
sentences.cn: 细分市场最简单的方法之一是放大性别差异，或者在以前不存在性别差异的地方创造性别差异。

sentences.en: The findings suggest that the body and brain have instinctive ways of healing that we could come to understand one day and then magnify.
sentences.cn: 这些发现表明身体与大脑具有其天生的自愈方法，我们有朝一日可以去理解并放大。
